author: xRisingForcex

text: @DLPBurke even if it were (which it isn't, by the way), majority opinion is responsible for all the failures in our oval office.  majority opinion is responsible for justin bieber and ke$ha's financial livelihood.  majority opinion is consistently the last ditch effort from someone in denial.  the majority's opinion is never inherently wrong, it's just never inherently right.  you could really be the poster child for a musical illiteracy awareness campaign though.
author: xRisingForcex

text: @DLPBurke you should take your own advice before you suggest others to.  the measures in the a section of this song alternate between VImaj7 and vm9 just as secret of the forest does, with identical chord voicings, and the ascending melody consisting entirely of sixteenth notes is the secret of the forest melody verbatim, as it highlights specific chord tones down to the note.  you can decorate it with whatever words you like but the similarities are beyond uncanny.
author: xRisingForcex

text: @DLPBurke the facts?.. i doubt you've even made the effort to transcribe the song
author: xRisingForcex

text: @DLPBurke i hope you're kidding.  this is as blatant as plagiarism gets.
author: xRisingForcex

text: @DLPBurke The instrumentation is entirely different, all that's the same is that underlying melody.  I happen to prefer this one CT's, it has a very jazzy feel to it and the bass just sounds so groovy.

@DLPBurke  doesn't really do that, either. the same type of bass, yeah, but aside from that they're all pretty different. acoustic guitar vs. harp, bagpipe-esque instrument vs. flute, etc. and the only real similarity is the central riff anyway - after it starts going places, they're completely different songs.

in general, you're hilariously angry reaction just kind of proves that you don't really know much about what you're talking about.
